Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class LeaderCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.LeaderCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
LeaderCardDiscount, LeaderCardProduction, LeaderCardSlots, LeaderCardWhiteMarble, SonOfLeaderCard
public abstract class LeaderCard extends Object implements Serializable
LeaderCard class models the Leader cards and their attributes
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • getRequiredCards

      public Map<CardType,​Integer> getRequiredCards()
      Returns:
      a Map containing the required cards of a Leader card

    • getRequiredResources

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getRequiredResources()
      Returns:
      a Map containing the required resources of a Leader card

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns:
      a Leader Card's ID

    • getAbilityResource

      public Resource getAbilityResource()

    • getVictoryPoints

      public int getVictoryPoints()
      Returns:
      a Leader card's Victory Points

    • isDiscarded

      public boolean isDiscarded()
      Returns:
      true if the Leader Card has been discarded, false otherwise

    • isActivated

      public boolean isActivated()
      Returns:
      true if the Leader Card has been activated, false otherwise

    • discard

      public void discard()
      sets a Leader Card's status to discarded

    • activate

      public void activate()
      sets a Leader Card's status to activated

    • getAbility

      public LeaderCardType getAbility()
      Returns:
      the LeaderCardType, to see which special ability the Leader Card has

    • getDiscountedCost

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getDiscountedCost​(Map<Resource,​Integer> originalCost)
      this method is for the discounted cost card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns the original cost. In the discounted cost card type, it changes the original cost and returns the discounted cost.

    • getWhiteMarbleResource

      public Resource getWhiteMarbleResource()
      this method is for the white marble card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns null. In the white marble card type, it returns the Resource to gain from the white marble.

    • getTotalRequiredResources

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getTotalRequiredResources​(Map<Resource,​Integer> oldRequiredResources)
      this method is for the production card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns the argument you pass. In the production card type, it returns the updated required resources for the production.

    • getTotalProducedResources

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getTotalProducedResources​(Map<Resource,​Integer> oldProducedResources, Resource addedResource)
      this method is for the production card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns the argument you pass. In the production card type, it returns the updated produced resources of the production.

    • getTotalProducedFP

      public int getTotalProducedFP​(int oldProducedFP)
      this method is for the production card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns the argument you pass. In the production card type, it returns the updated produced faith points of the production.

    • getFullSlotsNumber

      public Integer getFullSlotsNumber()
      this method is for the slots card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything but returns null. In the slots card type, it returns the number of full slots in the card (0,1,2).

    • addResource

      public void addResource()
      this method is for the slots card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything. In the slots card type, it adds (if there is space) a Resource in a slot.

    • removeResource

      public void removeResource()
      this method is for the slots card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything. In the slots card type, it removes a Resource (if there is one) from a slot.

    • setFullSlotsNumber

      public void setFullSlotsNumber​(int n)
      this method is for the slots card ability, it's redefined in that type of card, in the other types of cards it doesn't do anything. In the slots card type, it set to n the number of full slots in that card .
